page.title: 02Staploe, Settlements-Housing
page.content: Apart from scattered farms, the hamlets of Duloe, Staploe and Honeydon follow their respective brooks, with no obvious village centre. Duloe on higher ground above Duloe Brook, is grouped at a crossroads, then resumes the single file pattern along the St. Neots Road. Designating this an agricultural Priority Area, the County Structure Plan states "there is no scope for development not proven essential in the interests of agriculture". Staploe is the largest hamlet with 40 houses, 17 owner occupied, 15 council premises, 5 tied cottages, 3 rented. Duloe with 22 houses; 9 owned, 10 council (6 have been bought), 1 tied, 1 rented. Honeydon with 31 houses; 11 owned,18 tied, 2 rented. Honeydon is heavily farm based compared to elsewhere.
